alert.note: Alert for Grande Ronde Valley; Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 26 at 2:28PM PST until November 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM SUNDAY TO 4 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches above 4000 feet and 2 to 5 inches below 4000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Grande Ronde Valley and Wallowa County. * WHEN...From 7 AM Sunday to 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will create travel issues. Holiday travelers need to make sure vehicles are equipped for heavy snow which includes carrying traction devices or tires, shovels, and flashlights. Travelers may also consider alternate travel plans.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.
